intro: Anthodendron nudiflorum, commonly known as the nakedflower anthodendron, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
